title: Binary sequences meet the Fibonacci sequence
authors: Piotr Miska, Bartosz Sobolewski, Maciej Ulas
abstract:
Let $(u_{n})_{n\in \mathbb{N}}$ be a $k$-automatic sequence with values in
the set $\{0, 1\}$. In the paper, we consider properties of sequences
$(f(n))_{n\in\mathbb{N}}$ governed by the recurrence relations of the form
$f(n)=af(n-u_{n}-1)+bf(n-u_{n}-2)$. One of our main results states that under
mild assumptions on the sequence $(u_{n})_{n\in \mathbb{N}}$, the corresponding
set of quotients $\cal{V}(f):=\{f(n+1)/f(n):\;n\in\mathbb{N}\}$ is finite and
$k$-automatic. In particular, this property holds in the case when
$u_{n}=T_{n}$, where $(T_{n})_{n\in\mathbb{N}}$ is the famous
Prouhet-Thue-Morse sequence. We also study the cardinality of $\cal{V}(f)$ in
the case when $(u_{n})_{n\in \mathbb{N}}$ contains arbitrarily long blocks of
zeros or is ultimately periodic.
